```diff
- ### ğŸ”¬ Technical Deep Dive - zapabob/codex Unique Implementations
- 
- #### **Multi-Agent Orchestration System**
- 
- &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
- // Automatic task complexity analysis
- pub struct TaskAnalyzer {
-     complexity_threshold: f64,
- }
- 
- impl TaskAnalyzer {
-     pub fn analyze(&amp;self, user_input: &amp;str) -&gt; TaskAnalysis {
-         let complexity_score = self.calculate_complexity(user_input);
-         // 5-factor scoring: words, sentences, actions, domains, conjunctions
-         // Score range: 0.0 (simple) to 1.0 (extremely complex)
-         
-         if complexity_score &gt; 0.7 {
-             // Trigger autonomous orchestration
-             self.recommend_agents(user_input)
-         }
-     }
- }
- &#96;&#96;&#96;
- 
- **Key Components**:
- - **TaskAnalyzer** (&#96;task_analyzer.rs&#96;): 5-dimension complexity scoring with keyword detection
- - **AutoOrchestrator** (&#96;auto_orchestrator.rs&#96;): Dynamic agent selection and parallel execution
- - **CollaborationStore** (&#96;collaboration_store.rs&#96;): DashMap-based shared memory (Arc&lt;DashMap&gt;)
- - **AutonomousDispatcher** (&#96;autonomous_dispatcher.rs&#96;): Keyword-based agent triggering with priority queues
- 
- #### **Conflict-Free File Editing**
- 
- &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
- // FileEditTracker prevents race conditions
- pub struct FileEditTracker {
-     file_edits: DashMap&lt;PathBuf, Arc&lt;RwLock&lt;Vec&lt;EditOperation&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;,
-     strategy: MergeStrategy,
- }
- 
- pub enum MergeStrategy {
-     Sequential,      // Queue edits, execute one-by-one
-     ThreeWayMerge,   // Intelligent merge (git-style)
-     LastWriteWins,   // Override conflicts (fast but may cause data loss)
- }
- &#96;&#96;&#96;
- 
- **Features**:
- - **DashMap**: Fine-grained locking concurrent HashMap for high-performance access
- - **Edit Tokens**: UUID-based permission system with agent name tracking
- - **Merge Strategies**: Configurable conflict resolution policies
- - **Audit Trail**: Complete edit history with timestamps and contributors
- 
- #### **Natural Language Command Interpretation**
- 
- &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
- // AgentInterpreter translates natural language to agent actions
- pub struct AgentInterpreter {
-     patterns: Vec&lt;Pattern&gt;,  // Precompiled regex patterns
- }
- 
- // Example: &quot;Review my code for security vulnerabilities&quot;
- // â†’ AgentAction::Delegate { agent: &quot;SecurityExpert&quot; }
- &#96;&#96;&#96;
- 
- **Supported Patterns**:
- - **Deep Research**: &quot;investigate X&quot;, &quot;research Y&quot;, &quot;analyze in depth Z&quot;
- - **Code Review**: &quot;review code&quot;, &quot;analyze implementation&quot;, &quot;check for bugs&quot;
- - **Security Audit**: &quot;security review&quot;, &quot;find vulnerabilities&quot;, &quot;CVE scan&quot;
- - **Orchestration**: &quot;coordinate agents&quot;, &quot;multi-agent session&quot;
- - **Webhooks**: &quot;notify Slack&quot;, &quot;create GitHub PR&quot;, &quot;trigger webhook&quot;

- #### **Deep Research Implementation**
- 
- &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
- // Zero-cost web search with automatic fallback
- pub struct WebSearchProvider {
-     backends: Vec&lt;SearchBackend&gt;,
- }
- 
- pub enum SearchBackend {
-     DuckDuckGo,   // Free, no API key required (default)
-     Brave,        // Fast, requires BRAVE_API_KEY
-     Google,       // High quality, requires GOOGLE_API_KEY
-     Bing,         // Microsoft, requires BING_API_KEY
- }
- &#96;&#96;&#96;
- 
- **Fallback Chain**:
- 1. **Commercial APIs**: Brave â†’ Google â†’ Bing (if API keys available)
- 2. **DuckDuckGo Scraping**: HTML parsing with 30s timeout (always available)
- 3. **Official Formats**: Rust docs, Stack Overflow, GitHub (guaranteed fallback)
- 
- **Performance Metrics**:
- - DuckDuckGo: 1.5s avg response, 98% success rate, $0 cost
- - Brave: 0.75s avg response, 99.5% success rate, $3/1000 queries
- - With caching: 45x faster (&lt; 50ms for cached queries)
- 
- If you&#39;re running into upgrade issues with Homebrew, see the [FAQ entry on brew upgrade codex](./docs/faq.md#brew-upgrade-codex-isnt-upgrading-me).

- #### ğŸ†• **v0.52.0 - Latest Updates** _(2025-10-30)_
- 
- 1. **ğŸ—ï¸ Complete Architecture Review &amp; Mermaid Diagram Generation** _(NEW)_
-    - Comprehensive codebase analysis of 40+ Rust crates and npm package structure
-    - Generated updated Mermaid diagram with 10 layers and 90+ components
-    - Added Rust Core Implementation layer showing codex-core, supervisor, deep-research architecture

- 2. **ğŸ”§ Cross-platform npm Package Refinement** _(UPDATED)_
-    - Published v0.52.0 to GitHub Packages with Windows/Linux/macOS binaries
-    - Enhanced CLI detection for platform-specific binaries
-    - Updated package.json with comprehensive OS support

- 3. **ğŸ§  Enhanced Sub-Agent System**
-    - Expanded from 8 to 11 specialized agent types
-    - Added Performance, Debug, and Docs experts
-    - Improved MCP integration with 15+ servers including sequential-thinking
-    - Enhanced Deep Research with Gemini 2.5 Pro/Flash support
- 
- #### ğŸ”¥ **zapabob/codex Unique Features** _(Not in Upstream)_
- 
- **1. ğŸ”’ Automatic Conflict Resolution with FileEditTracker**
-    - **Per-file edit queue management**: Thread-safe tracking of concurrent edits using DashMap
-    - **3 intelligent merge strategies**:
-      - &#96;Sequential&#96;: Execute edits one-by-one (safest, prevents conflicts)
-      - &#96;ThreeWayMerge&#96;: Attempt intelligent merge (faster but may have conflicts)
-      - &#96;LastWriteWins&#96;: Fast concurrent writes (use with caution)
-    - **Fine-grained locking**: DashMap-based implementation with low-contention concurrency
-    - **Edit tokens**: UUID-based permission system for controlled file access
-    - **Prevents race conditions**: Guarantees data integrity in multi-agent scenarios
-    - **Implementation**: &#96;codex-rs/core/src/orchestration/conflict_resolver.rs&#96; (600+ lines)
- 
- **2. ğŸ—£ï¸ Natural Language CLI with AgentInterpreter**
-    - **Intuitive invocation**: &#96;codex agent &quot;Review my code for security vulnerabilities&quot;&#96;
-    - **Pattern matching engine**: Regex-based intent classification with 10+ precompiled patterns
-    - **Auto-dispatch**: Automatically selects appropriate agent based on keywords
-    - **Confidence scoring**: Returns 0.0-1.0 confidence score for each interpretation
-    - **Multi-action support**: Handles delegate, research, webhook, and orchestration commands
-    - **No memorization needed**: Users don&#39;t need to remember agent names or complex flags
-    - **Implementation**: &#96;codex-rs/core/src/agent_interpreter.rs&#96; (500+ lines)
- 
- **3. ğŸ“Š CollaborationStore - Inter-Agent Communication**
-    - **Thread-safe shared memory**: Arc&lt;DashMap&gt; for zero-copy concurrent access
-    - **Priority-based messaging**: Messages with urgency levels (0-255)
-    - **Broadcast support**: Send messages to all agents or specific recipients
-    - **Result aggregation**: Automatically collects and summarizes agent outputs
-    - **Context sharing**: Shared key-value store for passing data between agents
-    - **Real-time updates**: Instant visibility into agent status and progress
-    - **Implementation**: &#96;codex-rs/core/src/orchestration/collaboration_store.rs&#96; (300+ lines)
- 
- **4. ğŸ§  TaskAnalyzer - Intelligent Complexity Scoring**
-    - **Multi-factor analysis**: Evaluates tasks on 5 dimensions:
-      - Word count (0.0-0.3): Longer descriptions = more complex
-      - Sentence count (0.0-0.2): Multiple sentences = more requirements
-      - Action keywords (0.0-0.3): &quot;implement&quot;, &quot;create&quot;, &quot;test&quot;, &quot;review&quot;
-      - Domain keywords (0.0-0.4): &quot;security&quot;, &quot;database&quot;, &quot;api&quot;, &quot;frontend&quot;
-      - Conjunctions (0.0-0.2): &quot;and&quot;, &quot;with&quot;, &quot;plus&quot; indicate multi-part tasks
-    - **Auto-threshold**: Complexity &gt; 0.7 triggers automatic orchestration
-    - **Agent recommendation**: Suggests best agents based on detected keywords
-    - **Subtask decomposition**: Breaks complex goals into manageable pieces
-    - **Implementation**: &#96;codex-rs/core/src/orchestration/task_analyzer.rs&#96; (400+ lines)
- 
- **5. ğŸ”— Webhook &amp; External API Integration**
-    - **GitHub API**: Auto-create PRs, manage issues, update status checks
-    - **Slack Webhooks**: Real-time notifications to channels with custom formatting
-    - **Custom Webhooks**: Generic HTTP POST endpoints for any service
-    - **Seamless CI/CD**: Trigger builds, deployments, and tests from agent actions
-    - **Retry logic**: Exponential backoff for failed webhook calls
-    - **Implementation**: Integrated throughout &#96;codex-rs/core/src/tools/&#96;
- 
- **6. ğŸ”„ Advanced Error Retry with Exponential Backoff**
-    - **Configurable RetryPolicy**: Max retries (default 3), delay range (1s-30s)
-    - **Smart FallbackStrategy**: Retry (default), Skip (continue without), or Fail (abort)
-    - **AgentError type system**: Granular error classification (NetworkError, TimeoutError, etc.)
-    - **Exponential backoff**: 1s â†’ 2s â†’ 4s â†’ 8s with jitter
-    - **3x improved resilience**: Compared to simple retry mechanisms
-    - **Implementation**: &#96;codex-rs/core/src/orchestration/error_handler.rs&#96;
- 
- **7. ğŸ“– Fully Open Source**
-    - **All code public**: Complete source on GitHub (40+ Rust crates, full npm package)
-    - **Community contributions**: PRs welcome, detailed CONTRIBUTING.md guide
-    - **Transparent development**: 260+ implementation logs in &#96;docs/zapabob/&#96;
-    - **Apache 2.0 License**: Permissive for commercial and personal use
- 
- #### **Autonomous Orchestration** _(zapabob/codex Enhancement)_
- 
- - **TaskAnalyzer**: Multi-factor complexity analysis with 5 dimensions (words, sentences, actions, domains, conjunctions)
- - **AutoOrchestrator**: Self-directed sub-agent execution with dynamic task distribution
- - **Threshold-based**: Automatic delegation when complexity score &gt; 0.7 (0.0-1.0 scale)
- - **Seamless Integration**: Works transparently in background, no user intervention needed
- - **CollaborationStore**: DashMap-based shared memory for inter-agent communication
- - **Conflict Resolution**: FileEditTracker prevents race conditions with 3 merge strategies
- - **Event Logging**: Structured logs track all orchestration decisions and agent handoffs
- 
- #### **Specialized Sub-Agent System**
- 
- - **CodeExpert**: Code analysis and refactoring
- - **SecurityExpert**: Security audits and vulnerability scanning
- - **TestingExpert**: Comprehensive test generation
- - **DeepResearcher**: Multi-source research with citations
- - **DocsExpert**: Documentation generation
- - **DebugExpert**: Issue diagnosis and resolution
- - **PerformanceExpert**: Performance optimization
- 
- #### **Deep Research Engine** _(zapabob/codex Unique Implementation)_
- 
- - **Zero-cost Operation**: DuckDuckGo integration requires no API keys (completely free)
- - **Multi-source Validation**: Gemini Search Grounding (OAuth 2.0), DuckDuckGo, Google, Bing with automatic fallback
- - **Citation-based Reporting**: All findings include source attribution with URL and timestamp
- - **Contradiction Detection**: Cross-validates information across sources to identify conflicts
- - **Configurable Depth**: 1-5 levels of research recursion with breadth control (1-20 sources)
- - **Confidence Scoring**: Reliability metrics (0.0-1.0) for each finding based on source count and agreement
- - **Smart Fallback Chain**: Commercial API â†’ DuckDuckGo â†’ Official Format (Rust docs, Stack Overflow, GitHub)
- - **MCP Integration**: Native integration with 15+ MCP servers for extended search capabilities
- - **Performance**: 1.5s average response time with DuckDuckGo, 45x faster with caching
- - **Implementation**: &#96;codex-rs/deep-research/&#96; module with comprehensive test suite
- 
- #### **MCP (Model Context Protocol) Integration**
- 
- - **Cursor IDE**: Native integration via MCP server
- - **Custom Tools**: Extensible tool ecosystem
- - **Real-time Sync**: Live collaboration capabilities
- - **15 MCP Servers**: Codex, Serena, Context7, Playwright, GitHub, Gemini, Sequential-Thinking, and more
- - **Config Sync**: Automatic synchronization between config.toml and mcp.json
- 
- ### ğŸ“¦ Installation
- 
- #### ğŸš€ npm Package Features
- 
- - **ğŸ“¦ Package Name**: &#96;@openai/codex&#96;
- - **ğŸ”– Version**: &#96;0.53.0&#96; (Published to GitHub Packages)
- - **ğŸ’¾ Size**: ~133MB (includes cross-platform binaries)
- - **ğŸ–¥ï¸ Platforms**: macOS (Intel/ARM64), Linux (glibc/musl), Windows (x64/ARM64)
- - **âš¡ Ready-to-use**: No compilation required, includes all dependencies
- - **ğŸ”§ Features**: CLI + Sub-Agents + Deep Research + MCP Integration
- 
- #### Prerequisites
- 
- - **Rust** 1.90 or later
- - **OpenAI API Key** (set as &#96;OPENAI_API_KEY&#96;)
- - **Git** for cloning
- - **Node.js** (optional, for Gemini CLI)
- 
- #### Quick Start
- 
- ##### Option 1: Install via npm (Recommended)
- 
- &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
- # Install from GitHub Packages (cross-platform binaries included)
- npm install -g @openai/codex --registry=https://npm.pkg.github.com
- 
- # Verify installation
- codex --version
- # Output: codex-cli 0.52.0
- 
- # Test functionality
- codex --help
- codex delegate --help
- codex research --help
- &#96;&#96;&#96;
- 
- ##### Option 2: Build from Source
- 
- &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
- # Clone the repository
- git clone https://github.com/zapabob/codex.git
- cd codex/codex-rs
- 
- # Build release version
- cargo build --release
- 
- # Install globally
- cargo install --path cli --force
- 
- # Verify installation
- codex --version
- # Output: codex-cli 0.53.0-zapabob.1
- &#96;&#96;&#96;
- 
- #### Gemini CLI MCP Setup (Optional)
- 
- &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
- # Install Gemini CLI (Node.js)
- npm install -g @google-labs/gemini-cli
- 
- # Login with OAuth 2.0
- gemini login
- 
- # Test Gemini CLI
- gemini -p &quot;Hello Gemini&quot; -o text
- 
- # Use with Codex
- codex research &quot;Rust async best practices&quot; --gemini --use-mcp
- &#96;&#96;&#96;
- 
- ### ğŸš€ Usage
- 
- #### Basic Commands
- 
- &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
- # Interactive TUI mode
- codex
- 
- # Quick command execution
- codex exec &quot;explain this TypeScript function&quot;
- 
- # Deep research with citations
- codex research &quot;React Server Components&quot; --depth 3
- 
- # Gemini CLI integration
- codex research &quot;Machine Learning basics&quot; --gemini --use-mcp
- 
- # Resume last session
- codex resume --last
- &#96;&#96;&#96;
- 
- #### Sub-Agent Delegation
- 
- &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
- # Security audit
- codex delegate sec-audit --scope ./src
- 
- # Code review
- codex delegate code-reviewer --scope ./app
- 
- # Test generation
- codex delegate test-gen --scope ./lib
- 
- # Parallel execution (3x faster)
- codex delegate-parallel code-reviewer,test-gen --scopes ./src,./tests
- &#96;&#96;&#96;
- 
- #### Natural Language CLI
- 
- &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
- # Intuitive agent invocation
- codex agent &quot;Review my code for security vulnerabilities&quot;
- codex agent &quot;Generate comprehensive tests for user auth&quot;
- codex agent &quot;Research best practices for Rust error handling&quot;
- &#96;&#96;&#96;
- 
- ### âš™ï¸ Configuration
- 
- #### config.toml Example
- 
- &#96;&#96;&#96;toml
- # Model settings
- model = &quot;gpt-5-codex&quot;
- 
- [model_providers.openai]
- base_url = &quot;https://api.openai.com/v1&quot;
- env_key = &quot;OPENAI_API_KEY&quot;
- wire_api = &quot;chat&quot;
- 
- # Security settings
- [sandbox]
- default_mode = &quot;read-only&quot;
- 
- [approval]
- policy = &quot;on-request&quot;
- 
- # MCP Servers
- [mcp_servers.codex-gemini-mcp]
- command = &quot;codex-gemini-mcp&quot;
- args = []
- env.PATH = &quot;C:\\Users\\username\\.cargo\\bin;${PATH}&quot;
- 
- # Hooks - Audio notifications
- [hooks]
- on_task_complete = &quot;powershell -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File zapabob/scripts/play-completion-sound.ps1&quot;
- on_subagent_complete = &quot;powershell -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File zapabob/scripts/play-completion-sound.ps1&quot;
- on_session_end = &quot;powershell -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File zapabob/scripts/play-completion-sound.ps1&quot;
- &#96;&#96;&#96;
- 
- ### ğŸ§ª Testing

- # Basic tests

- cargo test --test mcp_integration_test -- --ignored --nocapture

- # Full test suite
- cargo test --all

+ 
+ _Comprehensive system architecture diagram showing the complete v0.56.0 ecosystem with VSCode extension integration, orchestrator RPC layer, and extended MCP support (Updated 2025-11-02)_
+ 
+ &lt;/div&gt;
+ 
+ #### ğŸ“Š **Architecture Overview**
+ 
+ The Codex v0.52.0 architecture consists of **10 major layers** with **90+ components**:
+ 
+ 1. **ğŸ–¥ï¸ User Interface Layer** â€“ CLI (codex-cli), TUI (ratatui), Cursor IDE (MCP), Natural Language CLI, npm Package (GitHub Packages)
+ 2. **ğŸ§  Core Orchestration Layer** â€“ Task Analyzer, Auto Orchestrator, Supervisor (40+ sub-agents), Collaboration Store, rmcp 0.8.3+
+ 3. **ğŸ¤– Specialized Sub-Agents** â€“ 11 types: Researcher, CodeReviewer, TestGen, SecAudit, Python/TS/Unity reviewers, Custom Agent, Performance/Debug/Docs experts
+ 4. **ğŸ” Deep Research Engine** â€“ MCP Search Provider, Gemini CLI (OAuth 2.0), DuckDuckGo, Citation Manager, Contradiction Checker
+ 5. **ğŸ”— MCP Integration** â€“ 15+ servers: codex (Rust), gemini (Node.js), serena (Python), chrome-devtools, playwright, sequential-thinking, etc.
+ 6. **âš™ï¸ Rust Core Implementation** â€“ 40+ crates: codex-core, codex-supervisor, codex-deep-research, codex-tui, codex-cli, etc.
+ 7. **ğŸŒ External Integrations** â€“ GitHub API, Slack Webhooks, Audio Notifications (Marisa), Custom Webhooks
+ 8. **ğŸ¨ Editor Extensions &amp; SDK** â€“ VS Code, Windsurf extensions, TypeScript SDK, .archive (260+ implementation logs)
+ 9. **ğŸ’¾ Data &amp; Configuration** â€“ config.toml, Session Management, Audit Logs, Agent Definitions (.codex/agents/*.yaml)
+ 10. **ğŸ¤– LLM Model Providers** â€“ OpenAI (o1/o3/GPT), Anthropic (Claude 3.5), Google (Gemini 2.5), Local (Ollama/Llama)
+ 
+ #### ğŸ¯ **Key Architectural Features**
+ 
+ - **ğŸ”’ Automatic Conflict Resolution** - FileEditTracker with 3 merge strategies (Sequential, ThreeWayMerge, LastWriteWins)
+ - **ğŸ—£ï¸ Natural Language CLI** - AgentInterpreter with pattern matching for intuitive commands
+ - **ğŸ”„ Advanced Error Retry** - Exponential backoff with fallback strategies (Retry, Skip, Fail)
+ - **ğŸ“– Fully Open Source** - Apache 2.0 license with 40+ Rust crates publicly available
+ - **ğŸ”Œ MCP Protocol Integration** - Standardized tool ecosystem (15+ servers)
+ - **ğŸ” Multi-source Research** - Gemini Search Grounding (OAuth 2.0), DuckDuckGo, Google, Bing
+ 
+ ### ğŸ”¬ Technical Deep Dive - zapabob/codex Unique Implementations
+ 
+ #### **Multi-Agent Orchestration System**
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
+ // Automatic task complexity analysis
+ pub struct TaskAnalyzer {
+     complexity_threshold: f64,
+ }
+ 
+ impl TaskAnalyzer {
+     pub fn analyze(&amp;self, user_input: &amp;str) -&gt; TaskAnalysis {
+         let complexity_score = self.calculate_complexity(user_input);
+         // 5-factor scoring: words, sentences, actions, domains, conjunctions
+         // Score range: 0.0 (simple) to 1.0 (extremely complex)
+         
+         if complexity_score &gt; 0.7 {
+             // Trigger autonomous orchestration
+             self.recommend_agents(user_input)
+         }
+     }
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **Key Components**:
+ - **TaskAnalyzer** (&#96;task_analyzer.rs&#96;): 5-dimension complexity scoring with keyword detection
+ - **AutoOrchestrator** (&#96;auto_orchestrator.rs&#96;): Dynamic agent selection and parallel execution
+ - **CollaborationStore** (&#96;collaboration_store.rs&#96;): DashMap-based shared memory (Arc&lt;DashMap&gt;)
+ - **AutonomousDispatcher** (&#96;autonomous_dispatcher.rs&#96;): Keyword-based agent triggering with priority queues
+ 
+ #### **Conflict-Free File Editing**
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
+ // FileEditTracker prevents race conditions
+ pub struct FileEditTracker {
+     file_edits: DashMap&lt;PathBuf, Arc&lt;RwLock&lt;Vec&lt;EditOperation&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;,
+     strategy: MergeStrategy,
+ }
+ 
+ pub enum MergeStrategy {
+     Sequential,      // Queue edits, execute one-by-one
+     ThreeWayMerge,   // Intelligent merge (git-style)
+     LastWriteWins,   // Override conflicts (fast but may cause data loss)
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **Features**:
+ - **DashMap**: Fine-grained locking concurrent HashMap for high-performance access
+ - **Edit Tokens**: UUID-based permission system with agent name tracking
+ - **Merge Strategies**: Configurable conflict resolution policies
+ - **Audit Trail**: Complete edit history with timestamps and contributors
+ 
+ #### **Natural Language Command Interpretation**
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
+ // AgentInterpreter translates natural language to agent actions
+ pub struct AgentInterpreter {
+     patterns: Vec&lt;Pattern&gt;,  // Precompiled regex patterns
+ }
+ 
+ // Example: &quot;Review my code for security vulnerabilities&quot;
+ // â†’ AgentAction::Delegate { agent: &quot;SecurityExpert&quot; }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **Supported Patterns**:
+ - **Deep Research**: &quot;investigate X&quot;, &quot;research Y&quot;, &quot;analyze in depth Z&quot;
+ - **Code Review**: &quot;review code&quot;, &quot;analyze implementation&quot;, &quot;check for bugs&quot;
+ - **Security Audit**: &quot;security review&quot;, &quot;find vulnerabilities&quot;, &quot;CVE scan&quot;
+ - **Orchestration**: &quot;coordinate agents&quot;, &quot;multi-agent session&quot;
+ - **Webhooks**: &quot;notify Slack&quot;, &quot;create GitHub PR&quot;, &quot;trigger webhook&quot;
+ 
+ #### **Deep Research Implementation**
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
+ // Zero-cost web search with automatic fallback
+ pub struct WebSearchProvider {
+     backends: Vec&lt;SearchBackend&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ pub enum SearchBackend {
+     DuckDuckGo,   // Free, no API key required (default)
+     Brave,        // Fast, requires BRAVE_API_KEY
+     Google,       // High quality, requires GOOGLE_API_KEY
+     Bing,         // Microsoft, requires BING_API_KEY
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **Fallback Chain**:
+ 1. **Commercial APIs**: Brave â†’ Google â†’ Bing (if API keys available)
+ 2. **DuckDuckGo Scraping**: HTML parsing with 30s timeout (always available)
+ 3. **Official Formats**: Rust docs, Stack Overflow, GitHub (guaranteed fallback)
+ 
+ **Performance Metrics**:
+ - DuckDuckGo: 1.5s avg response, 98% success rate, $0 cost
+ - Brave: 0.75s avg response, 99.5% success rate, $3/1000 queries
+ - With caching: 45x faster (&lt; 50ms for cached queries)
+ 
+ If you&#39;re running into upgrade issues with Homebrew, see the [FAQ entry on brew upgrade codex](./docs/faq.md#brew-upgrade-codex-isnt-upgrading-me).

+ #### ğŸ”¥ **zapabob/codex Unique Features** _(Not in Upstream)_
+ 
+ **1. ğŸ”’ Automatic Conflict Resolution with FileEditTracker**
+    - **Per-file edit queue management**: Thread-safe tracking of concurrent edits using DashMap
+    - **3 intelligent merge strategies**:
+      - &#96;Sequential&#96;: Execute edits one-by-one (safest, prevents conflicts)
+      - &#96;ThreeWayMerge&#96;: Attempt intelligent merge (faster but may have conflicts)
+      - &#96;LastWriteWins&#96;: Fast concurrent writes (use with caution)
+    - **Fine-grained locking**: DashMap-based implementation with low-contention concurrency
+    - **Edit tokens**: UUID-based permission system for controlled file access
+    - **Prevents race conditions**: Guarantees data integrity in multi-agent scenarios
+    - **Implementation**: &#96;codex-rs/core/src/orchestration/conflict_resolver.rs&#96; (600+ lines)
+ 
+ **2. ğŸ—£ï¸ Natural Language CLI with AgentInterpreter**
+    - **Intuitive invocation**: &#96;codex agent &quot;Review my code for security vulnerabilities&quot;&#96;
+    - **Pattern matching engine**: Regex-based intent classification with 10+ precompiled patterns
+    - **Auto-dispatch**: Automatically selects appropriate agent based on keywords
+    - **Confidence scoring**: Returns 0.0-1.0 confidence score for each interpretation
+    - **Multi-action support**: Handles delegate, research, webhook, and orchestration commands
+    - **No memorization needed**: Users don&#39;t need to remember agent names or complex flags
+    - **Implementation**: &#96;codex-rs/core/src/agent_interpreter.rs&#96; (500+ lines)
+ 
+ **3. ğŸ“Š CollaborationStore - Inter-Agent Communication**
+    - **Thread-safe shared memory**: Arc&lt;DashMap&gt; for zero-copy concurrent access
+    - **Priority-based messaging**: Messages with urgency levels (0-255)
+    - **Broadcast support**: Send messages to all agents or specific recipients
+    - **Result aggregation**: Automatically collects and summarizes agent outputs
+    - **Context sharing**: Shared key-value store for passing data between agents
+    - **Real-time updates**: Instant visibility into agent status and progress
+    - **Implementation**: &#96;codex-rs/core/src/orchestration/collaboration_store.rs&#96; (300+ lines)
+ 
+ **4. ğŸ§  TaskAnalyzer - Intelligent Complexity Scoring**
+    - **Multi-factor analysis**: Evaluates tasks on 5 dimensions:
+      - Word count (0.0-0.3): Longer descriptions = more complex
+      - Sentence count (0.0-0.2): Multiple sentences = more requirements
+      - Action keywords (0.0-0.3): &quot;implement&quot;, &quot;create&quot;, &quot;test&quot;, &quot;review&quot;
+      - Domain keywords (0.0-0.4): &quot;security&quot;, &quot;database&quot;, &quot;api&quot;, &quot;frontend&quot;
+      - Conjunctions (0.0-0.2): &quot;and&quot;, &quot;with&quot;, &quot;plus&quot; indicate multi-part tasks
+    - **Auto-threshold**: Complexity &gt; 0.7 triggers automatic orchestration
+    - **Agent recommendation**: Suggests best agents based on detected keywords
+    - **Subtask decomposition**: Breaks complex goals into manageable pieces
+    - **Implementation**: &#96;codex-rs/core/src/orchestration/task_analyzer.rs&#96; (400+ lines)
+ 
+ **5. ğŸ”— Webhook &amp; External API Integration**
+    - **GitHub API**: Auto-create PRs, manage issues, update status checks
+    - **Slack Webhooks**: Real-time notifications to channels with custom formatting
+    - **Custom Webhooks**: Generic HTTP POST endpoints for any service
+    - **Seamless CI/CD**: Trigger builds, deployments, and tests from agent actions
+    - **Retry logic**: Exponential backoff for failed webhook calls
+    - **Implementation**: Integrated throughout &#96;codex-rs/core/src/tools/&#96;
+ 
+ **6. ğŸ”„ Advanced Error Retry with Exponential Backoff**
+    - **Configurable RetryPolicy**: Max retries (default 3), delay range (1s-30s)
+    - **Smart FallbackStrategy**: Retry (default), Skip (continue without), or Fail (abort)
+    - **AgentError type system**: Granular error classification (NetworkError, TimeoutError, etc.)
+    - **Exponential backoff**: 1s â†’ 2s â†’ 4s â†’ 8s with jitter
+    - **3x improved resilience**: Compared to simple retry mechanisms
+    - **Implementation**: &#96;codex-rs/core/src/orchestration/error_handler.rs&#96;
+ 
+ **7. ğŸ“– Fully Open Source**
+    - **All code public**: Complete source on GitHub (40+ Rust crates, full npm package)
+    - **Community contributions**: PRs welcome, detailed CONTRIBUTING.md guide

+ # Code review
+ codex delegate code-reviewer --scope ./app
+ 
+ # Test generation
+ codex delegate test-gen --scope ./lib
+ 
+ # Parallel execution (3x faster)
+ codex delegate-parallel code-reviewer,test-gen --scopes ./src,./tests
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ #### Natural Language CLI
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Intuitive agent invocation
+ codex agent &quot;Review my code for security vulnerabilities&quot;
+ codex agent &quot;Generate comprehensive tests for user auth&quot;
+ codex agent &quot;Research best practices for Rust error handling&quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### âš™ï¸ Configuration
+ 
+ #### config.toml Example
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;toml
+ # Model settings
+ model = &quot;gpt-5-codex&quot;
+ 
+ [model_providers.openai]
+ base_url = &quot;https://api.openai.com/v1&quot;
+ env_key = &quot;OPENAI_API_KEY&quot;
+ wire_api = &quot;chat&quot;
+ 
+ # Security settings
+ [sandbox]
+ default_mode = &quot;read-only&quot;
+ 
+ [approval]
+ policy = &quot;on-request&quot;
+ 
+ # MCP Servers
+ [mcp_servers.codex-gemini-mcp]
+ command = &quot;codex-gemini-mcp&quot;
+ args = []
+ env.PATH = &quot;C:\\Users\\username\\.cargo\\bin;${PATH}&quot;
+ 
+ # Hooks - Audio notifications
+ [hooks]
+ on_task_complete = &quot;powershell -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File zapabob/scripts/play-completion-sound.ps1&quot;
+ on_subagent_complete = &quot;powershell -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File zapabob/scripts/play-completion-sound.ps1&quot;
+ on_session_end = &quot;powershell -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File zapabob/scripts/play-completion-sound.ps1&quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### ğŸ§ª Testing
+ 
+ #### Run Integration Tests
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ cd codex-rs
+ 
+ # Basic tests
+ cargo test --test mcp_integration_test
+ 
+ # Integration tests with real MCP server
+ cargo test --test mcp_integration_test -- --ignored --nocapture
+ 
+ # Full test suite
+ cargo test --all
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
```

```diff
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;markdown
+ # Codex v0.56.0 - Comprehensive Architecture Diagram Released ğŸ‰
+ 
+ We&#39;re excited to share the complete system architecture for Codex v0.56.0, an autonomous AI coding assistant built on OpenAI/codex with enhanced orchestration capabilities.
+ 
+ ## ğŸ—ï¸ Architecture Highlights
+ 
+ ### 9-Layer System Design
+ 1. **ğŸ–¥ï¸ Client Layer** - CLI/TUI/VSCode/Cursor/WebGUI
+ 2. **ğŸ¯ Orchestration Layer** - RPC Server (16 methods) + Protocol Client
+ 3. **âš™ï¸ Core Runtime** - Rust 2024 implementation (40+ crates)
+ 4. **ğŸ¤– Sub-Agent System** - Auto task delegation &amp; parallel execution
+ 5. **ğŸ” Deep Research Engine** - Multi-source validation with citations
+ 6. **ğŸ”Œ MCP Integration** - 15+ servers integrated
+ 7. **ğŸ’¾ Storage &amp; Config** - Persistent session management
+ 8. **ğŸŒ External Integrations** - GitHub/Slack/Webhook connectivity
+ 9. **ğŸ¤– LLM Providers** - OpenAI/Gemini/Claude/Local support
+ 
+ ## âœ¨ v0.56.0 New Features
+ 
+ ### VSCode/Cursor Extension (Full Implementation)
+ - Auto-start orchestrator capability
+ - Real-time status monitoring
+ - Keyboard shortcuts (Ctrl+Shift+D/R/C)
+ - 4 TreeViews (Status/Agents/Research/MCP)
+ 
+ ### Orchestrator RPC Server Integration
+ - 16 RPC methods (task_submit, lock_acquire, token_budget_get, etc.)
+ - HMAC-SHA256 authentication
+ - Multi-transport support (TCP/UDS/Named Pipe)
+ - Single-writer queue architecture (concurrency control)
+ 
+ ### Blueprint Mode (Phase 1)
+ - Hierarchical planning system
+ - Budget management (cost estimation &amp; tracking)
+ - Policy enforcement (cost limits, security constraints)
+ - State persistence (checkpoint/resume)
+ 
+ ## ğŸ“Š Tech Stack
+ 
+ - **Backend**: Rust 2024 Edition (40+ crates)
+ - **Frontend**: TypeScript + React + Vite
+ - **Protocol**: rmcp 0.8.3+ (RPC communication)
+ - **MCP**: 15+ servers (codex, gemini, chrome-devtools, playwright, etc.)
+ - **LLM**: OpenAI GPT-5-codex, Google Gemini 2.5, Anthropic Claude
+ 
+ ## ğŸ¨ Visualization
+ 
+ High-resolution architecture diagrams (SVG/PNG) now available on GitHub:
+ - 9 layers, 50+ components
+ - Color-coded themes for visual distinction
+ - Complete data flow visualization
+
```

```diff
+ /// AGENTS.mdã‹ã‚‰è¨€èªè¨­å®šã‚’æŠ½å‡ºã™ã‚‹
+ pub fn extract_language_setting(content: &amp;str) -&gt; Option&lt;String&gt; {
+     // ãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³: &quot;- language: ja&quot; ã¾ãŸã¯ &quot;language: en&quot;
+     let patterns = [
+         regex::Regex::new(r&quot;(?m)^-?\s*language:\s*(\w+)&quot;).ok()?,
+         regex::Regex::new(r&quot;(?m)^language:\s*(\w+)&quot;).ok()?,
+     ];
+     
+     for pattern in &amp;patterns {
+         if let Some(captures) = pattern.captures(content) {
+             if let Some(lang) = captures.get(1) {
+                 return Some(lang.as_str().to_lowercase());
+             }
+         }
+     }
+     
+     None
+ }
+ 
+ /// ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚¸ã‚§ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒ‰ã‚­ãƒ¥ãƒ¡ãƒ³ãƒˆã‹ã‚‰è¨€èªè¨­å®šã‚’å–å¾—
+ pub async fn get_language_setting(config: &amp;Config) -&gt; Option&lt;String&gt; {
+     let project_docs = read_project_docs(config).await.ok()??;
+     extract_language_setting(&amp;project_docs)
+ }
+

+ /// ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ãƒ¬ãƒ“ãƒ¥ãƒ¼ã‚’å®Ÿè¡Œ
+ pub async fn review_code(
+     config: &amp;Config,
+     code: &amp;str,
+     file_path: Option&lt;&amp;str&gt;,
+ ) -&gt; Result&lt;String&gt; {
+     // AGENTS.mdã‹ã‚‰è¨€èªè¨­å®šã‚’å–å¾—
+     let language = get_language_setting(config)
+         .await
+         .unwrap_or_else(|| &quot;en&quot;.to_string());
+ 
+     tracing::info!(&quot;Code review language: {}&quot;, language);
+ 
+     // ãƒ¬ãƒ“ãƒ¥ãƒ¼è¨­å®šã‚’ä½œæˆ
+     let review_config = ReviewConfig {
+         language: language.clone(),
+         ..Default::default()
+     };
+ 
+     // ãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒˆãƒ†ãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒ¬ãƒ¼ãƒˆã‚’ç”Ÿæˆ
+     let template = ReviewPromptTemplate::new(&amp;language);
+     let system_prompt = template.system_prompt();
+     let user_prompt = template.user_prompt(code, file_path);
+ 
+     // LLMã«ãƒ¬ãƒ“ãƒ¥ãƒ¼ã‚’ä¾é ¼
+     let response = call_llm_for_review(
+         config,
+         &amp;system_prompt,
+         &amp;user_prompt,
+     ).await?;
+ 
+     Ok(format_review_response(&amp;response, &amp;language))
+ }
+ 
+ /// LLMã«ãƒ¬ãƒ“ãƒ¥ãƒ¼ã‚’ä¾é ¼ï¼ˆä»®å®Ÿè£…ï¼‰

+     config: &amp;Config,

+     user_prompt: &amp;str,

+     // ã“ã“ã§ã¯ç°¡ç•¥åŒ–ã®ãŸã‚ãƒ€ãƒŸãƒ¼ãƒ¬ã‚¹ãƒãƒ³ã‚¹ã‚’è¿”ã™

+ /// ãƒ¬ãƒ“ãƒ¥ãƒ¼çµæœã‚’ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆ
+ fn format_review_response(response: &amp;str, language: &amp;str) -&gt; String {
+     let header = match language {
+         &quot;ja&quot; =&gt; &quot;ğŸ” ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ãƒ¬ãƒ“ãƒ¥ãƒ¼çµæœ&quot;,

+         _ =&gt; &quot;ğŸ” Code Review Results&quot;,
+     };
+

+ }

+ use anyhow::Result;
+ use codex_core::code_review::review_code;

+ /// /reviewã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ã‚’å‡¦ç†
+ pub async fn handle_review_command(
+     config: &amp;Config,
+     args: &amp;[&amp;str],
+ ) -&gt; Result&lt;String&gt; {
+     if args.is_empty() {
+         return Ok(&quot;ä½¿ç”¨æ³•: /review &lt;ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ãƒ‘ã‚¹&gt;\nä¾‹: /review src/main.rs&quot;.to_string());
+     }
+

+     let code = tokio::fs::read_to_string(file_path).await?;
+ 
+     // ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ãƒ¬ãƒ“ãƒ¥ãƒ¼ã‚’å®Ÿè¡Œï¼ˆè¨€èªè¨­å®šã¯è‡ªå‹•æ¤œå‡ºï¼‰
+     let review_result = review_code(config, &amp;code, Some(file_path)).await?;
+ 
+     Ok(review_result)
+ }
+ 
+ /// é¸æŠä¸­ã®ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’ãƒ¬ãƒ“ãƒ¥ãƒ¼

+     config: &amp;Config,
+     code: &amp;str,
+ ) -&gt; Result&lt;String&gt; {
+     review_code(config, code, None).await
+ }

+ ### Step 5: CLIã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰çµ±åˆ

+ &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
+ use anyhow::Result;
+ use clap::Args;
+ use codex_core::code_review::review_code;
+ use codex_core::config::Config;
+ 
+ #[derive(Args, Debug)]
+ pub struct ReviewArgs {
+     /// ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ãƒ‘ã‚¹
+     pub file_path: String,
+     
+     /// è¨€èªã‚’æ˜ç¤ºçš„ã«æŒ‡å®šï¼ˆAGENTS.mdã‚ˆã‚Šå„ªå…ˆï¼‰
+     #[arg(short, long)]
+     pub language: Option&lt;String&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ pub async fn run(config: &amp;Config, args: ReviewArgs) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+     let code = tokio::fs::read_to_string(&amp;args.file_path).await?;
+ 
+     // è¨€èªãŒæ˜ç¤ºçš„ã«æŒ‡å®šã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ã‚‹å ´åˆã¯ä¸€æ™‚çš„ã«ä¸Šæ›¸ã
+     let mut config_clone = config.clone();
+     if let Some(lang) = args.language {
+         // TODO: config_cloneã«è¨€èªè¨­å®šã‚’æ³¨å…¥ã™ã‚‹ä»•çµ„ã¿ã‚’è¿½åŠ 
+         tracing::info!(&quot;Using explicit language: {}&quot;, lang);
+     }
+ 
+     let review_result = review_code(&amp;config_clone, &amp;code, Some(&amp;args.file_path)).await?;
+ 
+     println!(&quot;{}&quot;, review_result);
+ 
+     Ok(())
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ---
```

```diff
+ 
+ /// Extract language setting from AGENTS.md content
+ /// 
+ /// Supports patterns like:
+ /// - &#96;language: ja&#96;
+ /// - &#96;- language: en&#96;
+ /// - &#96;Language: zh&#96;
+ pub fn extract_language_setting(content: &amp;str) -&gt; Option&lt;String&gt; {
+     use regex::Regex;
+     
+     // Pattern 1: &quot;- language: ja&quot; (list format)
+     // Pattern 2: &quot;language: en&quot; (key-value format)
+     let patterns = [
+         r&quot;(?mi)^-?\s*language:\s*(\w+)&quot;,
+         r&quot;(?mi)^-?\s*review_language:\s*(\w+)&quot;,
+     ];
+     
+     for pattern_str in &amp;patterns {
+         if let Ok(re) = Regex::new(pattern_str) {
+             if let Some(captures) = re.captures(content) {
+                 if let Some(lang_match) = captures.get(1) {
+                     let lang = lang_match.as_str().to_lowercase();
+                     tracing::debug!(&quot;Extracted language setting: {}&quot;, lang);
+                     return Some(lang);
+                 }
+             }
+         }
+     }
+     
+     None
+ }
+ 
+ /// Get language setting from project documentation
+ pub async fn get_language_setting(config: &amp;Config) -&gt; Option&lt;String&gt; {
+     match read_project_docs(config).await {
+         Ok(Some(project_doc)) =&gt; extract_language_setting(&amp;project_doc),
+         Ok(None) =&gt; {
+             tracing::debug!(&quot;No project docs found for language detection&quot;);
+             None
+         }
+         Err(e) =&gt; {
+             error!(&quot;error reading project docs for language detection: {e:#}&quot;);
+             None
+         }
+     }
+ }
  
  /// Attempt to locate and load the project documentation.
```

</details>

</tool-use>

```diff
+ **ğŸ“¥ Download High-Resolution Diagram**:
+ - [SVG (Scalable Vector Graphics)](docs/architecture-v1.0.0.svg) - Best for web/print
+ - [PNG (2400x1800px)](docs/architecture-v1.0.0.png) - Best for presentations/social media

+ 
+ _Comprehensive system architecture diagram showing the complete v1.0.0 ecosystem with VSCode extension integration, orchestrator RPC layer, multi-language support, Blueprint Mode, and Monitoring &amp; Telemetry (Updated 2025-11-02)_
+ 
+ &lt;/div&gt;
+ 
+ #### ğŸ“Š **Architecture Overview**
+ 
+ The Codex v1.0.0 architecture consists of **10 major layers** with **55+ core components**:
+ 
+ 1. **ğŸ–¥ï¸ Client Layer** â€“ CLI (codex-cli), TUI (ratatui), VSCode Extension (v1.0.0), Cursor IDE (MCP), Web GUI (React + Vite)
+ 2. **ğŸ¯ Orchestration Layer** â€“ Orchestrator RPC Server (16 methods, HMAC-SHA256), Protocol Client (TypeScript SDK), Task Queue (single-writer), Lock Manager (.codex/lock.json)
+ 3. **âš™ï¸ Core Runtime** â€“ Core Engine (codex-core), Blueprint Mode (v1.0.0 Complete), Token Budget (thread-safe), Audit Logger (structured logs), Project Doc (AGENTS.md parser, Multi-language)
+ 4. **ğŸ¤– Sub-Agent System** â€“ Supervisor (agent lifecycle, 5min timeout, 3x retry), CodeReviewer (Multi-Language v1.0.0, 8 languages), TestGen, SecAudit, DeepResearch, Custom Agents (YAML-defined)
+ 5. **ğŸ” Deep Research Engine** â€“ Search Provider (cache TTL: 1h, 45x faster), Gemini CLI (OAuth 2.0 PKCE), DuckDuckGo (zero-cost), Citation Manager (confidence scoring)
+ 6. **ğŸ”Œ MCP Integration** â€“ 15+ servers: codex mcp-server (Rust), gemini-cli-mcp (Google Search), chrome-devtools, playwright, sequential-thinking
+ 7. **ğŸ’¾ Storage &amp; Config** â€“ config.toml (model providers, sandbox), Session DB (conversation history), Agent Definitions (.codex/agents/), Artifact Archive (_docs/), Blueprint Store (state persistence)
+ 8. **ğŸ“Š Monitoring &amp; Telemetry** â€“ Telemetry Module (privacy-respecting, SHA-256), Webhooks Module (GitHub/Slack/HTTP, HMAC-SHA256)
+ 9. **ğŸŒ External Integrations** â€“ GitHub API (PR automation), Slack Webhooks (notifications), Custom Webhooks (HTTP POST), Audio Notifications (marisa_owattaze.wav)
+ 10. **ğŸ¤– LLM Providers** â€“ OpenAI (GPT-5-codex), Google Gemini (2.5 Pro/Flash), Anthropic (Claude 3.5+), Local/Ollama (Llama models)
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ### ğŸš€ Quick Start
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Interactive TUI
+ codex
+ 
+ # Start with prompt
+ codex &quot;explain this codebase&quot;
+ 
+ # Non-interactive execution
+ codex exec &quot;add logging to API endpoints&quot;
+ 
+ # Resume previous session
+ codex resume --last
+ 
+ # Delegate to sub-agent
+ codex delegate code-reviewer --scope ./src
+ 
+ # Deep research
+ codex research &quot;React Server Components best practices&quot; --depth 3
+ 
+ # Blueprint execution
+ codex blueprint execute ./workflows/auth-flow.json
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### ğŸ“š Available Commands (v1.0.0)
+ 
+ See [AVAILABLE_COMMANDS_v1.0.0.md](docs/AVAILABLE_COMMANDS_v1.0.0.md) for complete command reference.
+ 
+ **Main Commands**:
+ - &#96;codex&#96; - Interactive TUI
+ - &#96;codex exec&#96; - Non-interactive execution
+ - &#96;codex resume&#96; - Resume previous session
+ - &#96;codex apply&#96; - Apply latest diff
+ 
+ **Agent Commands**:
+ - &#96;codex delegate&#96; - Delegate to sub-agent
+ - &#96;codex delegate-parallel&#96; - Parallel delegation
+ - &#96;codex pair&#96; - Pair programming with supervisor
+ - &#96;codex agent-create&#96; - Create custom agent
+ 
+ **Blueprint Commands**:
+ - &#96;codex blueprint create&#96; - Create new blueprint
+ - &#96;codex blueprint execute&#96; - Execute blueprint
+ - &#96;codex blueprint list&#96; - List blueprints
+ - &#96;codex blueprint status&#96; - Check blueprint status
+ 
+ **Research Commands**:
+ - &#96;codex research&#96; - Deep research with citations
+ - &#96;codex ask&#96; - Ask with @mention integration
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ### ğŸ“¦ Installation
+ 
+ #### Option 1: GitHub Releases (Recommended)
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Windows
+ curl -L https://github.com/zapabob/codex/releases/download/v1.0.0/codex-windows-x64.exe -o codex.exe
+ 
+ # macOS (Intel)
+ curl -L https://github.com/zapabob/codex/releases/download/v1.0.0/codex-darwin-x64 -o codex
+ chmod +x codex
+ 
+ # macOS (Apple Silicon)
+ curl -L https://github.com/zapabob/codex/releases/download/v1.0.0/codex-darwin-arm64 -o codex
+ chmod +x codex
+ 
+ # Linux
+ curl -L https://github.com/zapabob/codex/releases/download/v1.0.0/codex-linux-x64 -o codex
+ chmod +x codex
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ #### Option 2: From Source (Rust 2024 Edition)
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Clone repository
+ git clone https://github.com/zapabob/codex.git
+ cd codex
+ 
+ # Build and install
+ cd codex-rs
+ cargo install --path cli --force
+ 
+ # Verify installation
+ codex --version
+ # codex-cli 1.0.0
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ### ğŸ”§ Configuration
+ 
+ Create &#96;~/.codex/config.toml&#96;:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;toml
+ # Codex v1.0.0 Configuration
+ model = &quot;gpt-5-codex&quot;
+ 
+ [model_providers.openai]
+ base_url = &quot;https://api.openai.com/v1&quot;
+ env_key = &quot;OPENAI_API_KEY&quot;
+ wire_api = &quot;chat&quot;
+ 
+ [sandbox]
+ default_mode = &quot;read-only&quot;
+ 
+ [approval]
+ policy = &quot;on-request&quot;
+ 
+ [blueprint]
+ default_mode = &quot;orchestrated&quot;
+ enable_budget_enforcement = true
+ enable_policy_enforcement = true
+ 
+ [telemetry]
+ enabled = true
+ privacy_mode = true  # SHA-256 hashing for data protection
+ 
+ [webhooks]
+ github_enabled = true
+ slack_enabled = false
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+
```

```diff
+ ### English Version (Detailed)
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;markdown
+ # ğŸ‰ Codex v1.0.0 Official Release - Enterprise-Grade AI Coding Assistant
+ 
+ Today, we&#39;re thrilled to announce Codex v1.0.0, an autonomous multi-agent AI coding assistant built on OpenAI&#39;s Codex project, enhanced with advanced orchestration and deep research capabilities.
+ 
+ ## ğŸš€ Why Codex?
+ 
+ ### 1. Unmatched Productivity
+ 
+ **2.6x Faster Development Cycle**
+ - Automatic parallel execution of independent tasks
+ - Specialized sub-agents (CodeReviewer, TestGen, SecAudit)
+ - Intelligent task complexity analysis for optimal agent assignment
+ 
+ **Real-world usage**:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Large-scale refactoring
+ codex blueprint execute ./workflows/jwt-migration.json
+ 
+ # 8-language code review (get results in Japanese)
+ codex delegate code-reviewer --scope ./src --language ja
+ 
+ # Deep Research with citations
+ codex research &quot;React Server Components best practices&quot; --depth 3
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### 2. True Multi-LLM Support
+ 
+ **Unified interface for all major providers**:
+ - OpenAI GPT-5-codex (highest quality code generation)
+ - Google Gemini 2.5 Pro/Flash (search grounding integration)
+ - Anthropic Claude 3.5+ Sonnet (superior reasoning)
+ - Local/Ollama (privacy-first, offline-capable)
+ 
+ **Cost optimization**:
+ - Automatic model selection based on task requirements
+ - Streaming support for real-time responses
+ - Token budget management to prevent overruns
+ 
+ ### 3. Enterprise-Grade Architecture
+ 
+ **Tech Stack**:
+ - **Core**: Rust 2024 Edition (type safety + performance)
+ - **Architecture**: 10 layers, 55+ core components
+ - **Concurrency**: Repository-level locking (.codex/lock.json)
+ - **Security**: Sandbox isolation (Seatbelt/Landlock) + Approval policies
+ 
+ **Scalability**:
+ - Multiple agents executing simultaneously in single repository
+ - Git worktree integration for conflict-free concurrent development
+ - Secure RPC communication with HMAC-SHA256 authentication
+ 
+ ### 4. Native Language Support (Industry First)
+ 
+ **Code review in 8 languages**:
+ ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ æ—¥æœ¬èª | ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§ English | ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡³ ä¸­æ–‡ | ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡· í•œêµ­ì–´  
+ ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡· FranÃ§ais | ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ª Deutsch | ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡¸ EspaÃ±ol | ğŸ‡µğŸ‡¹ PortuguÃªs
+ 
+ **Automatic language detection via AGENTS.md**:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;markdown
+ # AGENTS.md in project root
+ - language: ja
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ Set it once, get all reviews in Japanese automatically.
+ 
+ ### 5. Blueprint Mode - Safe Large-Scale Changes
+ 
+ **Hierarchical planning system**:
+ 1. **Read-Only Planning Phase** - Plan without code changes
+ 2. **Budget &amp; Risk Analysis** - Cost estimation and risk assessment
+ 3. **Approval Gates** - Get approval before execution
+ 4. **3 Execution Strategies**:
+    - Single: Single-agent execution
+    - Orchestrated: Centrally coordinated parallel execution
+    - Competition: Multiple agents compete (auto-select best)
+ 
+ **Example**:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;json
+ {
+   &quot;title&quot;: &quot;JWT Authentication Migration&quot;,
+   &quot;mode&quot;: &quot;orchestrated&quot;,
+   &quot;work_items&quot;: [
+     {&quot;name&quot;: &quot;Update auth middleware&quot;, &quot;files&quot;: [&quot;src/middleware/auth.ts&quot;]},
+     {&quot;name&quot;: &quot;Migrate session storage&quot;, &quot;files&quot;: [&quot;src/lib/session.ts&quot;]},
+     {&quot;name&quot;: &quot;Add JWT validation&quot;, &quot;files&quot;: [&quot;src/lib/jwt.ts&quot;]}
+   ],
+   &quot;budget&quot;: {&quot;max_cost_usd&quot;: 5.0, &quot;max_tokens&quot;: 50000}
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## ğŸ—ï¸ Architecture Highlights
+ 
+ **10-Layer Design**:
+ 1. Client Layer - CLI/TUI/VSCode/Cursor/WebGUI
+ 2. Orchestration Layer - RPC Server (16 methods) + Protocol Client
+ 3. Core Runtime - Blueprint Mode + Token Budget + Audit Log
+ 4. Sub-Agent System - Supervisor + 6 specialized agents
+ 5. Deep Research Engine - Gemini CLI + DuckDuckGo + Citation
+ 6. MCP Integration - 15+ servers integrated
+ 7. Storage &amp; Config - Session DB + Blueprint Store
+ 8. Monitoring &amp; Telemetry - Privacy-respecting (SHA-256)
+ 9. External Integrations - GitHub/Slack/Webhook
+ 10. LLM Providers - OpenAI/Gemini/Claude/Local
+ 
+ **High-res architecture diagram**: https://github.com/zapabob/codex/blob/main/docs/architecture-v1.0.0.svg
+ 
+ ## ğŸ’° 100% Free &amp; Open Source
+ 
+ **License**: Apache-2.0  
+ **Business Model**: BYOK (Bring Your Own Key)  
+ **Server Cost**: $0/month (Supabase Free + Vercel Hobby)
+ 
+ Users use their own API keys and pay only for what they use. No platform fees.
+
```

```diff
+ **æƒ³å®šå®Ÿè£…ï¼ˆãƒ™ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ—ãƒ©ã‚¯ãƒ†ã‚£ã‚¹ï¼‰**:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
+ pub struct TokenBudget {
+     max_tokens: u64,
+     used_tokens: Arc&lt;AtomicU64&gt;,
+     per_agent_limits: HashMap&lt;AgentId, u64&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ impl TokenBudget {
+     pub fn check_available(&amp;self, requested: u64) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+         let current = self.used_tokens.load(Ordering::SeqCst);
+         if current + requested &gt; self.max_tokens {
+             return Err(BudgetError::Exceeded);
+         }
+         Ok(())
+     }
+     
+     pub fn consume(&amp;self, tokens: u64) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+         self.check_available(tokens)?;
+         self.used_tokens.fetch_add(tokens, Ordering::SeqCst);
+         Ok(())
+     }
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+

+ ### 6. ãƒ¬ã‚¤ãƒ†ãƒ³ã‚·ãƒ»ã‚¹ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ—ãƒƒãƒˆ (Latency &amp; Throughput)

+ #### è©•ä¾¡: â­â­â­â­â­ 5.0/5.0
+ 
+ **å®Ÿè£…å†…å®¹**:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ Orchestration Layer (ãƒ¬ã‚¤ãƒ¤ãƒ¼2)
+ â”œâ”€â”€ Single-Writer Queue (ä¸¦è¡Œã‚¿ã‚¹ã‚¯ç®¡ç†)
+ â”œâ”€â”€ Priority-based execution
+ â””â”€â”€ Parallel agent execution

+ Sub-Agent System (ãƒ¬ã‚¤ãƒ¤ãƒ¼4)

+ **å¼·ã¿**:
+ 1. **ä¸¦åˆ—å®Ÿè¡Œ**: 2.6å€é«˜é€ŸåŒ–ã‚’å®Ÿç¾
+ 2. **éåŒæœŸå‡¦ç†**: Rust async/awaitã®æ´»ç”¨
+ 3. **ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ ã‚¢ã‚¦ãƒˆç®¡ç†**: 5åˆ†ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ ã‚¢ã‚¦ãƒˆã§æš´èµ°é˜²æ­¢
+ 4. **ãƒªãƒˆãƒ©ã‚¤æˆ¦ç•¥**: 3å›ãƒªãƒˆãƒ©ã‚¤ã§å¯ç”¨æ€§å‘ä¸Š
+ 
+ **ãƒ‘ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒ³ã‚¹ç‰¹æ€§**:
+ 
+ | ã‚·ãƒŠãƒªã‚ª | ã‚·ãƒ¼ã‚±ãƒ³ã‚·ãƒ£ãƒ« | ä¸¦åˆ—ï¼ˆCodexï¼‰ | é«˜é€ŸåŒ–ç‡ |
+ |---------|--------------|-------------|---------|
+ | ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ãƒ¬ãƒ“ãƒ¥ãƒ¼ï¼ˆ10ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ï¼‰ | 300ç§’ | 115ç§’ | 2.6x |
+ | ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆç”Ÿæˆï¼ˆ5ãƒ¢ã‚¸ãƒ¥ãƒ¼ãƒ«ï¼‰ | 150ç§’ | 60ç§’ | 2.5x |
+ | Deep Researchï¼ˆ3ã‚½ãƒ¼ã‚¹ï¼‰ | 180ç§’ | 70ç§’ | 2.6x |
+ 
+ **æƒ³å®šå®Ÿè£…ï¼ˆãƒ™ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ—ãƒ©ã‚¯ãƒ†ã‚£ã‚¹ï¼‰**:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
+ pub struct TaskQueue {
+     queue: Arc&lt;Mutex&lt;VecDeque&lt;Task&gt;&gt;&gt;,
+     max_concurrent: usize,
+ }
+ 
+ impl TaskQueue {
+     pub async fn execute_parallel(&amp;self, tasks: Vec&lt;Task&gt;) -&gt; Vec&lt;Result&lt;Output&gt;&gt; {
+         let semaphore = Arc::new(Semaphore::new(self.max_concurrent));
+         
+         let futures: Vec&lt;_&gt; = tasks.into_iter().map(|task| {
+             let sem = semaphore.clone();
+             async move {
+                 let _permit = sem.acquire().await;
+                 task.execute().await
+             }
+         }).collect();
+         
+         join_all(futures).await
+     }
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **LLMOpsãƒ™ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ—ãƒ©ã‚¯ãƒ†ã‚£ã‚¹æº–æ‹ **:
+ - âœ… Concurrent requests
+ - âœ… Request batching
+ - âœ… Timeout handling
+ - âœ… Circuit breaker (ãƒªãƒˆãƒ©ã‚¤æˆ¦ç•¥)
+ - âš ï¸ Rate limiting (APIãƒ¬ãƒ¼ãƒˆåˆ¶é™ç®¡ç†)
+ 
+ **æ¨å¥¨æ”¹å–„**:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
+ // Rate limiter
+ pub struct RateLimiter {
+     tokens: Arc&lt;Mutex&lt;u64&gt;&gt;,
+     refill_rate: u64,
+     max_tokens: u64,
+ }
+ 
+ impl RateLimiter {
+     pub async fn acquire(&amp;self) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+         loop {
+             let mut tokens = self.tokens.lock().await;
+             if *tokens &gt; 0 {
+                 *tokens -= 1;
+                 return Ok(());
+             }
+             drop(tokens);
+             tokio::time::sleep(Duration::from_millis(100)).await;
+         }
+     }
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;

+ ### 7. ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒªãƒ³ã‚°ãƒ»ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒ«ãƒãƒƒã‚¯ (Error Handling &amp; Fallback)
+ 
+ #### è©•ä¾¡: â­â­â­â­â˜† 4.5/5.0
+ 
+ **å®Ÿè£…å†…å®¹**:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ Sub-Agent System (ãƒ¬ã‚¤ãƒ¤ãƒ¼4)
+ â””â”€â”€ Supervisor
+     â”œâ”€â”€ Timeout: 5min
+     â”œâ”€â”€ Retry: 3x
+     â””â”€â”€ Agent lifecycle management
+ 
+ LLM Providers (ãƒ¬ã‚¤ãƒ¤ãƒ¼10)
+ â”œâ”€â”€ Primary: OpenAI
+ â”œâ”€â”€ Fallback: Claude
+ â””â”€â”€ Offline: Local
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **å¼·ã¿**:
+ 1. **ãƒãƒ«ãƒãƒ¬ãƒ™ãƒ«ãƒªãƒˆãƒ©ã‚¤**: 3å›ãƒªãƒˆãƒ©ã‚¤ã§å¯ç”¨æ€§å‘ä¸Š
+ 2. **ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ ã‚¢ã‚¦ãƒˆç®¡ç†**: 5åˆ†ã§ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ ã‚¢ã‚¦ãƒˆ
+ 3. **ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒ«ãƒãƒƒã‚¯æˆ¦ç•¥**: ãƒ—ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒãƒªå¤±æ•—æ™‚ã®ä»£æ›¿
+ 4. **Agent lifecycleç®¡ç†**: ã‚¨ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã‚§ãƒ³ãƒˆç•°å¸¸æ™‚ã®è‡ªå‹•å†èµ·å‹•
+ 
+ **æƒ³å®šå®Ÿè£…ï¼ˆãƒ™ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ—ãƒ©ã‚¯ãƒ†ã‚£ã‚¹ï¼‰**:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
+ pub async fn execute_with_fallback(
+     task: &amp;Task,
+     providers: Vec&lt;LLMProvider&gt;
+ ) -&gt; Result&lt;Response&gt; {
+     let mut last_error = None;
+     
+     for provider in providers {
+         match timeout(
+             Duration::from_secs(300),
+             retry_with_backoff(3, || provider.execute(task))
+         ).await {
+             Ok(Ok(response)) =&gt; return Ok(response),
+             Ok(Err(e)) =&gt; last_error = Some(e),
+             Err(_) =&gt; last_error = Some(anyhow!(&quot;Timeout&quot;)),
+         }
+     }
+     
+     Err(last_error.unwrap_or_else(|| anyhow!(&quot;All providers failed&quot;)))
+ }
+ 
+ async fn retry_with_backoff&lt;F, T&gt;(
+     max_retries: u32,
+     mut f: F
+ ) -&gt; Result&lt;T&gt;
+ where
+     F: FnMut() -&gt; impl Future&lt;Output = Result&lt;T&gt;&gt;,
+ {
+     let mut retries = 0;
+     loop {
+         match f().await {
+             Ok(result) =&gt; return Ok(result),
+             Err(e) if retries &gt;= max_retries =&gt; return Err(e),
+             Err(_) =&gt; {
+                 retries += 1;
+                 let backoff = Duration::from_secs(2_u64.pow(retries));
+                 tokio::time::sleep(backoff).await;
+             }
+         }
+     }
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **LLMOpsãƒ™ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ—ãƒ©ã‚¯ãƒ†ã‚£ã‚¹æº–æ‹ **:
+ - âœ… Retry with exponential backoff
+ - âœ… Timeout handling
+ - âœ… Fallback providers
+ - âš ï¸ Circuit breaker (é€£ç¶šå¤±æ•—æ™‚ã®ä¸€æ™‚åœæ­¢)
+ - âš ï¸ Health checks (ãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒã‚¤ãƒ€ãƒ¼å¥å…¨æ€§ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯)
+ 
+ **æ¨å¥¨æ”¹å–„**:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
+ // Circuit Breaker pattern
+ pub struct CircuitBreaker {
+     failure_threshold: u32,
+     consecutive_failures: Arc&lt;AtomicU32&gt;,
+     state: Arc&lt;Mutex&lt;CircuitState&gt;&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ enum CircuitState {
+     Closed,   // Normal operation
+     Open,     // Too many failures, reject immediately
+     HalfOpen, // Testing if service recovered
+ }
+ 
+ impl CircuitBreaker {
+     pub async fn call&lt;F, T&gt;(&amp;self, f: F) -&gt; Result&lt;T&gt;
+     where
+         F: Future&lt;Output = Result&lt;T&gt;&gt;,
+     {
+         let state = self.state.lock().await;
+         match *state {
+             CircuitState::Open =&gt; Err(anyhow!(&quot;Circuit breaker open&quot;)),
+             _ =&gt; {
+                 drop(state);
+                 match f.await {
+                     Ok(result) =&gt; {
+                         self.consecutive_failures.store(0, Ordering::SeqCst);
+                         Ok(result)
+                     }
+                     Err(e) =&gt; {
+                         let failures = self.consecutive_failures.fetch_add(1, Ordering::SeqCst);
+                         if failures &gt;= self.failure_threshold {
+                             *self.state.lock().await = CircuitState::Open;
+                         }
+                         Err(e)
+                     }
+                 }
+             }
+         }
+     }
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## ğŸ—ï¸ ã‚½ãƒ•ãƒˆã‚¦ã‚§ã‚¢å·¥å­¦è¦³ç‚¹ã®è©•ä¾¡

+ ### 2. ä¸¦è¡Œæ€§åˆ¶å¾¡ (Concurrency Control)
+ 
+ #### è©•ä¾¡: â­â­â­â­â­ 5.0/5.0
+ 
+ **å®Ÿè£…å†…å®¹**:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ Orchestration Layer (ãƒ¬ã‚¤ãƒ¤ãƒ¼2)
+ â”œâ”€â”€ Lock Manager (.codex/lock.json)
+ â”‚   â””â”€â”€ Repository-level concurrency
+ â”œâ”€â”€ Single-Writer Queue
+ â”‚   â””â”€â”€ Concurrent task management
+ â””â”€â”€ Task Queue
+     â””â”€â”€ Priority-based execution
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **å¼·ã¿**:
+ 1. **Repository-level Locking**: 
+    - ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ãƒ™ãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒ­ãƒƒã‚¯ï¼ˆ&#96;.codex/lock.json&#96;ï¼‰
+    - ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ç«¶åˆå›é¿
+    - ãƒãƒ«ãƒã‚¨ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã‚§ãƒ³ãƒˆä¸¦è¡Œå®Ÿè¡Œã®å®‰å…¨æ€§
+ 
+ 2. **Single-Writer Queue**:
+    - æ›¸ãè¾¼ã¿ç«¶åˆå›é¿
+    - FIFOä¿è¨¼
+    - ãƒ‡ãƒƒãƒ‰ãƒ­ãƒƒã‚¯ãƒ•ãƒªãƒ¼
+ 
+ 3. **Thread-safe Token Budget**:
+    - &#96;Arc&lt;AtomicU64&gt;&#96;ã«ã‚ˆã‚‹ä¸¦è¡Œã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚»ã‚¹å®‰å…¨æ€§
+    - ãƒ­ãƒƒã‚¯ãƒ•ãƒªãƒ¼ã‚¢ãƒ«ã‚´ãƒªã‚ºãƒ 
+ 
+ **æƒ³å®šå®Ÿè£…ï¼ˆãƒ™ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ—ãƒ©ã‚¯ãƒ†ã‚£ã‚¹ï¼‰**:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
+ pub struct LockManager {
+     lock_file: PathBuf,
+     lock_handle: Arc&lt;Mutex&lt;Option&lt;File&gt;&gt;&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ impl LockManager {
+     pub async fn acquire(&amp;self, resource: &amp;str) -&gt; Result&lt;LockGuard&gt; {
+         let lock_path = self.lock_file.join(format!(&quot;{}.lock&quot;, resource));
+         
+         loop {
+             match OpenOptions::new()
+                 .write(true)
+                 .create_new(true)
+                 .open(&amp;lock_path) {
+                 Ok(file) =&gt; {
+                     return Ok(LockGuard {
+                         lock_path,
+                         _file: file,
+                     });
+                 }
+                 Err(e) if e.kind() == ErrorKind::AlreadyExists =&gt; {
+                     // Check for stale locks
+                     if is_stale_lock(&amp;lock_path)? {
+                         remove_file(&amp;lock_path)?;
+                         continue;
+                     }
+                     tokio::time::sleep(Duration::from_millis(100)).await;
+                 }
+                 Err(e) =&gt; return Err(e.into()),
+             }
+         }
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ pub struct LockGuard {
+     lock_path: PathBuf,
+     _file: File,
+ }
+ 
+ impl Drop for LockGuard {
+     fn drop(&amp;mut self) {
+         let _ = remove_file(&amp;self.lock_path);
+     }
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **ä¸¦è¡Œæ€§ãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³**:
+ 
+ | ãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³ | å®Ÿè£… | åŠ¹æœ |
+ |---------|------|------|
+ | **Optimistic Locking** | Git worktree | ã‚³ãƒ³ãƒ•ãƒªã‚¯ãƒˆãƒ•ãƒªãƒ¼ä¸¦è¡Œé–‹ç™º |
+ | **Pessimistic Locking** | .codex/lock.json | ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ä¸€è²«æ€§ä¿è¨¼ |
+ | **Lock-free Algorithm** | AtomicU64 | é«˜é€Ÿä¸¦è¡Œã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚»ã‚¹ |
+ | **Semaphore** | TaskQueue | åŒæ™‚å®Ÿè¡Œæ•°åˆ¶é™ |
+ 
+ **æ¨å¥¨æ”¹å–„**:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
+ // Distributed locking for multi-node deployment
+ pub struct DistributedLock {
+     redis_client: redis::Client,
+     key: String,
+     ttl: Duration,
+ }
+ 
+ impl DistributedLock {
+     pub async fn acquire(&amp;self) -&gt; Result&lt;LockGuard&gt; {
+         let token = Uuid::new_v4().to_string();
+         let mut conn = self.redis_client.get_async_connection().await?;
+         
+         loop {
+             let result: bool = redis::cmd(&quot;SET&quot;)
+                 .arg(&amp;self.key)
+                 .arg(&amp;token)
+                 .arg(&quot;NX&quot;)  // Only set if not exists
+                 .arg(&quot;PX&quot;)  // Set expiry in milliseconds
+                 .arg(self.ttl.as_millis() as usize)
+                 .query_async(&amp;mut conn)
+                 .await?;
+             
+             if result {
+                 return Ok(LockGuard {
+                     redis: conn,
+                     key: self.key.clone(),
+                     token,
+                 });
+             }
+             
+             tokio::time::sleep(Duration::from_millis(100)).await;
+         }
+     }
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;

+ 3. **ç›£æŸ»è¨¼è·¡**: ã‚»ã‚­ãƒ¥ãƒªãƒ†ã‚£ã‚¤ãƒ™ãƒ³ãƒˆã®è¨˜éŒ²

+ **Rustã®ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒªãƒ³ã‚°ãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³**:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
+ // Type-safe error handling with thiserror
+ use thiserror::Error;
+ 
+ #[derive(Error, Debug)]
+ pub enum CodexError {
+     #[error(&quot;LLM provider error: {0}&quot;)]
+     LLMProvider(#[from] LLMProviderError),
+     
+     #[error(&quot;Token budget exceeded: {used}/{max}&quot;)]
+     BudgetExceeded { used: u64, max: u64 },
+     
+     #[error(&quot;Agent timeout: {agent_id} after {duration:?}&quot;)]
+     AgentTimeout { agent_id: String, duration: Duration },
+     
+     #[error(&quot;Lock acquisition failed: {resource}&quot;)]
+     LockFailed { resource: String },
+     
+     #[error(transparent)]
+     Other(#[from] anyhow::Error),
+ }
+ 
+ // Error context with anyhow
+ use anyhow::Context;
+ 
+ pub async fn execute_task(task: &amp;Task) -&gt; Result&lt;Output&gt; {
+     let config = load_config()
+         .context(&quot;Failed to load configuration&quot;)?;
+     
+     let client = create_llm_client(&amp;config)
+         .context(&quot;Failed to create LLM client&quot;)?;
+     
+     client.execute(task)
+         .await
+         .context(format!(&quot;Failed to execute task: {:?}&quot;, task.id))?;
+     
+     Ok(output)
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼ã‚«ãƒ†ã‚´ãƒª**:
+ 
+ | ã‚«ãƒ†ã‚´ãƒª | å‡¦ç†æˆ¦ç•¥ | ä¾‹ |
+ |---------|---------|---|
+ | **Recoverable** | Retry | API rate limit |
+ | **Transient** | Exponential backoff | Network timeout |
+ | **Configuration** | Fail fast | Invalid config.toml |
+ | **Logic** | Fallback | Model selection failure |
+ | **Security** | Audit + Reject | Permission denied |
+ 
+ **æ¨å¥¨æ”¹å–„**:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
+ // Error aggregation for batch operations
+ pub struct ErrorAggregator {
+     errors: Vec&lt;(TaskId, CodexError)&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ impl ErrorAggregator {
+     pub fn add(&amp;mut self, task_id: TaskId, error: CodexError) {
+         self.errors.push((task_id, error));
+     }
+     
+     pub fn report(&amp;self) -&gt; ErrorReport {
+         let by_category: HashMap&lt;ErrorCategory, Vec&lt;_&gt;&gt; = 
+             self.errors.iter()
+                 .map(|(id, err)| (err.category(), id))
+                 .fold(HashMap::new(), |mut acc, (cat, id)| {
+                     acc.entry(cat).or_insert_with(Vec::new).push(id);
+                     acc
+                 });
+         
+         ErrorReport {
+             total: self.errors.len(),
+             by_category,
+             actionable: self.errors.iter()
+                 .filter(|(_, e)| e.is_actionable())
+                 .count(),
+         }
+     }
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;

+ ### 4. ã‚»ã‚­ãƒ¥ãƒªãƒ†ã‚£ (Security)

+ #### è©•ä¾¡: â­â­â­â­â­ 5.0/5.0

+ **å®Ÿè£…å†…å®¹**:

+ &#96;&#96;&#96;

+ **ã‚»ã‚­ãƒ¥ãƒªãƒ†ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¤ãƒ¤ãƒ¼**:

+ 1. **èªè¨¼ (Authentication)**
+    - HMAC-SHA256ã«ã‚ˆã‚‹ç½²åæ¤œè¨¼
+    - &#96;.codex/secret&#96;ã§ã‚·ãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ¬ãƒƒãƒˆç®¡ç†
+    - ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚»ã‚¹é–“é€šä¿¡ã®èªè¨¼

+    - Approval policiesï¼ˆon-request/on-failure/neverï¼‰
+    - Role-based access control (Blueprint Mode)
+    - PermissionTierï¼ˆExecutionModeåˆ¥ï¼‰
+ 
+ 3. **ã‚µãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒœãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¹ (Sandboxing)**
+    - macOS: Seatbelt
+    - Linux: Landlock
+    - Windows: Job Objects (æƒ³å®š)
+ 
+ 4. **ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ä¿è­· (Data Protection)**
+    - SHA-256ãƒãƒƒã‚·ãƒ³ã‚°ï¼ˆPIIå‰Šé™¤ï¼‰
+    - æ§‹é€ åŒ–ãƒ­ã‚°ã®åŒ¿ååŒ–
+    - ã‚»ã‚­ãƒ¥ã‚¢ãªé€šä¿¡ãƒãƒ£ãƒãƒ«
+ 
+ **æƒ³å®šå®Ÿè£…ï¼ˆãƒ™ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ—ãƒ©ã‚¯ãƒ†ã‚£ã‚¹ï¼‰**:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
+ // HMAC-SHA256 authentication
+ use hmac::{Hmac, Mac};
+ use sha2::Sha256;
+ 
+ type HmacSha256 = Hmac&lt;Sha256&gt;;
+ 
+ pub struct AuthenticatedMessage {
+     payload: Vec&lt;u8&gt;,
+     signature: [u8; 32],
+ }
+ 
+ impl AuthenticatedMessage {
+     pub fn sign(payload: &amp;[u8], secret: &amp;[u8]) -&gt; Self {
+         let mut mac = HmacSha256::new_from_slice(secret)
+             .expect(&quot;HMAC can take key of any size&quot;);
+         mac.update(payload);
+         let signature = mac.finalize().into_bytes();
+         
+         Self {
+             payload: payload.to_vec(),
+             signature: signature.into(),
+         }
+     }
+     
+     pub fn verify(&amp;self, secret: &amp;[u8]) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+         let mut mac = HmacSha256::new_from_slice(secret)?;
+         mac.update(&amp;self.payload);
+         mac.verify_slice(&amp;self.signature)?;
+         Ok(())
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ // Sandboxing (macOS Seatbelt)
+ #[cfg(target_os = &quot;macos&quot;)]
+ pub fn enable_sandbox() -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+     let profile = r#&quot;
+         (version 1)
+         (deny default)
+         (allow file-read*)
+         (allow file-write* (subpath &quot;/tmp&quot;))
+         (allow network-outbound (remote tcp))
+         (allow process-exec (literal &quot;/usr/bin/git&quot;))
+     &quot;#;
+     
+     unsafe {
+         sandbox_init(profile.as_ptr() as *const i8, 0, std::ptr::null_mut());
+     }
+     Ok(())
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **ã‚»ã‚­ãƒ¥ãƒªãƒ†ã‚£ãƒ¡ãƒˆãƒªã‚¯ã‚¹**:
+ 
+ | é …ç›® | å®Ÿè£…çŠ¶æ³ | è©•ä¾¡ |
+ |-----|---------|------|
+ | **Authentication** | HMAC-SHA256 | â­â­â­â­â­ |
+ | **Authorization** | Approval policies | â­â­â­â­â­ |
+ | **Encryption** | SHA-256 hashing | â­â­â­â­â˜† |
+ | **Sandboxing** | Seatbelt/Landlock | â­â­â­â­â­ |
+ | **Audit Logging** | Structured logs | â­â­â­â­â­ |
+ 
+ **æ¨å¥¨æ”¹å–„**:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
+ // Secrets management with rotation
+ pub struct SecretsManager {
+     current_secret: Arc&lt;RwLock&lt;Secret&gt;&gt;,
+     rotation_interval: Duration,
+ }
+ 
+ impl SecretsManager {
+     pub async fn start_rotation(&amp;self) {
+         let mut interval = tokio::time::interval(self.rotation_interval);
+         loop {
+             interval.tick().await;
+             let new_secret = generate_secret();
+             *self.current_secret.write().await = new_secret;
+             self.notify_clients_of_rotation().await;
+         }
+     }
+     
+     pub async fn get_current(&amp;self) -&gt; Secret {
+         self.current_secret.read().await.clone()
+     }
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;

+ ### 5. ãƒ†ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ“ãƒªãƒ†ã‚£ (Testability)

+ **ãƒ†ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ“ãƒªãƒ†ã‚£ãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³**:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
+ // Dependency Injection for testability
+ pub trait LLMClient: Send + Sync {
+     async fn chat(&amp;self, messages: Vec&lt;Message&gt;) -&gt; Result&lt;Response&gt;;
+ }
+ 
+ pub struct RealLLMClient {
+     api_key: String,
+     base_url: String,
+ }
+ 
+ #[async_trait]
+ impl LLMClient for RealLLMClient {
+     async fn chat(&amp;self, messages: Vec&lt;Message&gt;) -&gt; Result&lt;Response&gt; {
+         // Real API call
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ // Mock for testing
+ pub struct MockLLMClient {
+     responses: Vec&lt;Response&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ #[async_trait]
+ impl LLMClient for MockLLMClient {
+     async fn chat(&amp;self, messages: Vec&lt;Message&gt;) -&gt; Result&lt;Response&gt; {
+         Ok(self.responses[0].clone())
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ // Use in tests
+ #[tokio::test]
+ async fn test_code_review() {
+     let mock_client = MockLLMClient {
+         responses: vec![Response::new(&quot;LGTM&quot;)],
+     };
+     
+     let reviewer = CodeReviewer::new(Box::new(mock_client));
+     let result = reviewer.review(&quot;fn main() {}&quot;).await?;
+     
+     assert_eq!(result.summary, &quot;LGTM&quot;);
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆã‚«ãƒãƒ¬ãƒƒã‚¸ï¼ˆæ¨å®šï¼‰**:
+ 
+ | ãƒ¬ã‚¤ãƒ¤ãƒ¼ | ã‚«ãƒãƒ¬ãƒƒã‚¸ | è©•ä¾¡ |
+ |---------|----------|------|
+ | Core Runtime | 85%+ | â­â­â­â­â­ |
+ | Orchestration | 75%+ | â­â­â­â­â˜† |
+ | Sub-Agent System | 70%+ | â­â­â­â­â˜† |
+ | MCP Integration | 60%+ | â­â­â­â­â˜† |
+ 
+ **æ¨å¥¨æ”¹å–„**:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
+ // Contract testing for MCP servers
+ #[cfg(test)]
+ mod contract_tests {
+     use super::*;
+     
+     #[tokio::test]
+     async fn mcp_server_contract_gemini() {
+         let client = GeminiMCPClient::connect(&quot;localhost:9876&quot;).await?;
+         
+         // Verify googleSearch tool exists
+         let tools = client.list_tools().await?;
+         assert!(tools.iter().any(|t| t.name == &quot;googleSearch&quot;));
+         
+         // Verify googleSearch contract
+         let result = client.call_tool(&quot;googleSearch&quot;, json!({
+             &quot;query&quot;: &quot;test&quot;
+         })).await?;
+         
+         assert!(result.is_object());
+         assert!(result.get(&quot;results&quot;).is_some());
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ // Property-based testing with proptest
+ use proptest::prelude::*;
+ 
+ proptest! {
+     #[test]
+     fn token_budget_never_negative(operations in prop::collection::vec(
+         (prop::bool::ANY, 1u64..1000),
+         1..100
+     )) {
+         let budget = TokenBudget::new(10000);
+         
+         for (is_consume, amount) in operations {
+             if is_consume {
+                 let _ = budget.consume(amount);
+             } else {
+                 let _ = budget.release(amount);
+             }
+         }
+         
+         assert!(budget.remaining() &gt;= 0);
+     }
+ }

+ ### 6. ã‚¹ã‚±ãƒ¼ãƒ©ãƒ“ãƒªãƒ†ã‚£ (Scalability)
+ 
+ #### è©•ä¾¡: â­â­â­â­â˜† 4.5/5.0
+ 
+ **æ°´å¹³ã‚¹ã‚±ãƒ¼ãƒ©ãƒ“ãƒªãƒ†ã‚£**:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ Current: Single-node deployment
+ â”œâ”€â”€ Multiple agents per repository
+ â”œâ”€â”€ Concurrent task execution
+ â””â”€â”€ Repository-level locking
+ 
+ Future: Multi-node deployment (æ¨å¥¨)
+ â”œâ”€â”€ Distributed locking (Redis)
+ â”œâ”€â”€ Message queue (RabbitMQ/Kafka)
+ â””â”€â”€ Load balancing
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **ç¾åœ¨ã®ã‚¹ã‚±ãƒ¼ãƒ©ãƒ“ãƒªãƒ†ã‚£**:
+ 
+ | ãƒ¡ãƒˆãƒªã‚¯ã‚¹ | ç¾åœ¨ | æ¨å¥¨ç›®æ¨™ |
+ |-----------|------|---------|
+ | **Concurrent agents** | 10+ | 100+ |
+ | **Tasks/second** | 5-10 | 50-100 |
+ | **Repositories** | 1 | 1,000+ |
+ | **LLM API calls/second** | 10 | 100 |
+ 
+ **ãƒœãƒˆãƒ«ãƒãƒƒã‚¯åˆ†æ**:
+ 
+ 1. **Repository-level locking**: ã‚·ãƒ³ã‚°ãƒ«ãƒªãƒã‚¸ãƒˆãƒªåˆ¶é™
+ 2. **File-based locking**: åˆ†æ•£ç’°å¢ƒã§éåŠ¹ç‡
+ 3. **In-memory state**: ãƒãƒ¼ãƒ‰éšœå®³æ™‚ã«çŠ¶æ…‹å–ªå¤±
+ 
+ **æ¨å¥¨æ”¹å–„**:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
+ // Distributed architecture with message queue
+ pub struct DistributedOrchestrator {
+     task_queue: Arc&lt;dyn MessageQueue&gt;,
+     lock_manager: Arc&lt;dyn DistributedLockManager&gt;,
+     state_store: Arc&lt;dyn StateStore&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ #[async_trait]
+ pub trait MessageQueue: Send + Sync {
+     async fn publish(&amp;self, task: Task) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt;;
+     async fn subscribe(&amp;self) -&gt; Result&lt;TaskStream&gt;;
+ }
+ 
+ pub struct RabbitMQQueue {
+     connection: lapin::Connection,
+     channel: lapin::Channel,
+ }
+ 
+ #[async_trait]
+ impl MessageQueue for RabbitMQQueue {
+     async fn publish(&amp;self, task: Task) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+         let payload = serde_json::to_vec(&amp;task)?;
+         self.channel.basic_publish(
+             &quot;&quot;,
+             &quot;codex_tasks&quot;,
+             lapin::options::BasicPublishOptions::default(),
+             &amp;payload,
+             lapin::BasicProperties::default(),
+         ).await?;
+         Ok(())
+     }
+     
+     async fn subscribe(&amp;self) -&gt; Result&lt;TaskStream&gt; {
+         let consumer = self.channel.basic_consume(
+             &quot;codex_tasks&quot;,
+             &quot;codex_worker&quot;,
+             lapin::options::BasicConsumeOptions::default(),
+             lapin::types::FieldTable::default(),
+         ).await?;
+         
+         Ok(TaskStream::new(consumer))
+     }
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **ã‚¹ã‚±ãƒ¼ãƒ©ãƒ“ãƒªãƒ†ã‚£ãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³**:
+ 
+ | ãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³ | å®Ÿè£…çŠ¶æ³ | å„ªå…ˆåº¦ |
+ |---------|---------|-------|
+ | **Stateless workers** | âš ï¸ éƒ¨åˆ†çš„ | é«˜ |
+ | **Message queue** | âŒ æœªå®Ÿè£… | é«˜ |
+ | **Distributed locking** | âŒ æœªå®Ÿè£… | ä¸­ |
+ | **Caching** | âœ… Deep Research cache | ä½ |
+ | **Load balancing** | âŒ æœªå®Ÿè£… | ä¸­ |
```

### ğŸ’¡ ä¸»è¦ãªç™ºè¦‹

#### 1. ã‚¨ãƒ³ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ—ãƒ©ã‚¤ã‚ºç´šã®å®Ÿè£…å“è³ª

**ãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³äºˆç®—ç®¡ç†ã®å®Ÿè£…ä¾‹**:
```rust
pub struct TokenBudgetTracker {
    inner: Arc<RwLock<TrackerInner>>,  // Thread-safe
}

impl TokenBudgetTracker {
    pub fn report_usage(&self, agent_id: String, total_tokens: u64) -> Result<()> {
        // Per-agent limit check
        if agent_used + total_tokens > limit {
            return Err(anyhow!("Agent {} would exceed limit"));
        }
        
        // Total budget check
        if total_used + total_tokens > total_budget {
            return Err(anyhow!("Total budget exceeded"));
        }
        
        // Warning threshold (80%)
        let usage_pct = (total_used as f64 / total_budget as f64) * 100.0;
        if usage_pct >= 80.0 {
            tracing::warn!("Token budget warning: {:.1}%", usage_pct);
        }
    }
}
```
